intro: Gnaphalium inornatum, commonly known as the slender cudweed, is a herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its small, white flowers are arranged in compact clusters, and it produces fine, hairy leaves. Gnaphalium inornatum is often found in disturbed soils and can serve as an indicator of wetland environments.
